questions.question: What is the primary purpose of descriptive statistics?

options.B: To summarize and describe the features of a dataset.

questions.explanation: Descriptive statistics are used to summarize and describe the main features of a dataset, providing a simple overview.

questions.question: Which measure of central tendency is the middle value in a dataset?
questions.explanation: The median is the middle value in a dataset when the data points are arranged in order.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a frequency distribution?

options.A: To display the number of occurrences of each value in a dataset.

questions.explanation: A frequency distribution displays the number of occurrences of each value in a dataset, helping to understand the distribution.

questions.question: Which graphical representation is used to show the relationship between two variables?
questions.explanation: A scatter plot is used to show the relationship between two variables by displaying data points on a two-dimensional graph.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a histogram?

options.B: To show the distribution of a dataset.

questions.explanation: A histogram is used to show the distribution of a dataset by displaying the frequency of data points within certain ranges.

questions.question: Which measure of variability is the average of the squared differences from the mean?
questions.explanation: Variance is the average of the squared differences from the mean, providing a measure of how much the data points vary.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a box plot?

options.A: To display the distribution of a dataset.
options.B: To show the relationship between two variables.

questions.explanation: A box plot displays the distribution of a dataset by showing the median, quartiles, and potential outliers.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a pie chart?

options.A: To display the distribution of a dataset.
options.B: To show the relationship between two variables.
options.C: To display categorical data as proportions.

questions.explanation: A pie chart displays categorical data as proportions of a whole, with each slice representing a category's proportion.

questions.question: Which measure of central tendency is the most frequently occurring value in a dataset?
questions.explanation: The mode is the most frequently occurring value in a dataset, representing the most common data point.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a line graph?
questions.explanation: A line graph is used to show trends over time by connecting data points with a line, illustrating changes in values.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a bar chart?

options.B: To show the relationship between two variables.

questions.explanation: A bar chart displays categorical data by representing each category with a bar, showing the frequency or proportion of each category.

questions.question: Which measure of variability is the square root of the variance?
questions.explanation: Standard deviation is the square root of the variance, providing a measure of how much the data points deviate from the mean.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a stem-and-leaf plot?

options.B: To show the distribution of a dataset.

questions.explanation: A stem-and-leaf plot displays the distribution of a dataset by showing the frequency of data points within certain ranges.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a dot plot?

options.B: To show the distribution of a dataset.

questions.explanation: A dot plot displays the distribution of a dataset by showing the frequency of data points within certain ranges.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a Pareto chart?

options.B: To show the distribution of a dataset.
options.C: To identify the most significant factors in a dataset.

questions.explanation: A Pareto chart identifies the most significant factors in a dataset by displaying the frequency or proportion of each category.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a cumulative frequency distribution?

options.B: To show the distribution of a dataset.
options.D: To show the cumulative frequency of data points.

questions.explanation: A cumulative frequency distribution shows the cumulative frequency of data points, helping to understand the distribution.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a frequency polygon?

options.B: To show the distribution of a dataset.

questions.explanation: A frequency polygon shows the distribution of a dataset by connecting the midpoints of each class interval with a line.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a contingency table?

options.B: To show the relationship between two variables.

questions.explanation: A contingency table shows the relationship between two variables by displaying the frequency of data points in each category.
